comments.text:
Hey everyone. I'm 14 Years old And my favorite subject In high school is 
Computing Science. I'm In my 3rd year of High school and 3 more to go. I 
have been coding for 4 months, But i took 1/2 months worth of break. So I 
started doing it again. I can honestly say I love coding until my hear 
contents break!, I had a website I made for myself, I had the domain and 
hosting but the guy took it away. He gave me it as a gift free for one 
year, So I'm currently working on A new website and i will give it to 
anyone who needs it for free. All I ask Is for if anyone could get me a 
domain and one year hosting for free!! , because I'm buying a new 
whiteboard on Tuesday and I wouldn't be able to purchase them both. The 
whiteboard Is to enhance my coding tutorials!﻿

comments.author: insane_lennit

comments.text:
The connotation that the word programmer carries for how intelligent 
someone is laughable once you become one. The media and the average person 
lumps the difficulty of all types of programming under the difficulty of 
the lowest level and most complicated applications of programming. As far 
as what was shown in the video, he was teaching him javascript and html. It 
doesn't take a genius to learn javascript and a markup language like html ( 
or any programming language for that matter). Anyone who is willing to 
learn about how computers work and is a remotely logical can learn to 
program. The only genius involved with programming is innovation and 
aggregation of ideas that are already present to solve an unsolved or 
currently inadequately solved problem. That being said, I am fine with 
letting those people stay uninformed on the subject just in case I ever 
need to get paid decently in the future and I don't really want to work 
that hard.﻿

comments.author: Wild Academy

comments.text:
Two "cosmopolitan" types, both wearing cool urban chic outfits, and cool 
urban chic hair cuts, lovingly regard each other in mutual sexual 
attraction, as they BOTH play themselves off against a pathetic black dude, 
who doesn't know what time it is. Throw in a pudgy Bridget Jones type and 
"voila", you have the makings of a hollywood "feel good" that stinks of 
ripe fromunda cheese.
On the surface, this special interest segment was about narcissistic 
self-promotion at the expence of a stupid black guy's dignity, but MORE 
importantly, this piece is another excercise in mass-media's daily IDENTITY 
re-enforcement.﻿

part of it (the easy part). So, fortunately, this is human nature.

comments.author: Beauty

comments.text:
Because he didn't just do it privately, Patrick drew a lot of public 
interest by writing about the story.  People are naturally skeptical. 
 Think of it this way: "For every action there's an equal and opposite 
reaction".  And also: "First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then 
they fight you, then you win."  Unfortunately, this is human nature.
